name: Hotel Veritas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay at Hotel Veritas while visiting Boston to watch the Blue Jays play the Red Sox. We decided on this perticalar hotel due to the reviews it was given, and were not disapointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: Upon arrival after out long drive, which was about 10pm, we parked out in front of the hotel to unload our things. We were immediatly greeted by the front desk staff member, who offered to help us with our belongings. She also took care of parking our car (which is about $30 a night - quite reasonable considering the other options around the area).
reviews.title: Beautifully appointed boutique in Cambridge handy for Boston.

reviews.text: The rooms were small, as expected from the discriptions on the website, but very cozy - plently of room for 2 people (and we were in the petite queen), and very beatifuly decorated.
reviews.title: Good quiet location

reviews.text: The hotel is located right in the harvard square area, which is a very neat place to visit. You can check out all the small shops and restaurants, or walk around the Harvard Campus. It is also close to Boston, which you can take a cab to for $20, or the bus for $2. (we took the bus on the way back to the hotel afetr the game, and it was quite simple - about an 8 minute drive)
reviews.title: Cute hotel

reviews.text: Overall, we would highly reccomend the Hotel to anyone looking to visit the Boston/Cambridge area. We would for sure stay here again! Amazing Hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent... but the rooms are small.

reviews.text: Very nice and convenient location close to Harvard Square. Compared to most other Hotels we have stayed while at Harvard, this one is probably the best. Great Service and a Staff that takes care of you.
reviews.title: good but left some mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, for the price (and I have to accept the that graduation week leads to profit maximization in all Cambridge Hotels) the room was actually small, but nicely decorated and practical. You need to be able to cope with the noise of the traffic, primarily the terribly noisy buses coming down Mass Ave. If you cannot sleep with that noise, go somewhere else!
reviews.title: Stylish decor and great location

reviews.text: The hotel was very nicely decorated (someone has an eye for details! The textured wallpaper was beautiful) and the room was bright and cozy. A bit on the small side, but the large balcony with comfortable chairs made us quickly forget the room size! The staff was friendly and the business room on the ground floor was a cozy (and free!) place to check emails and print boarding passes. The location is great - just a few steps away is the heart of Harvard Square. I found quite a few little shops and boutiques I would never have found if I stayed in another location. And walking past J.P. Licks twice a day made stopping for ice cream so convenient!
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel -

reviews.text: This is a beautiful Hotel ... decor and design is perfect. Loved the public spaces on first level. Loved the complimentary beverage area. It has been designed and maintained with care. Great shower and fluffy cotton towels. Crisp clean linens ---
reviews.title: Fabulously appointed tiny rooms in Harvard Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small but cozy ... luxurious feel.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret in Boston!

reviews.text: Stayed in room 206 for three nights. It’s a petite queen – by far the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in worldwide, including NYC and Europe. It was OK for one person but would be pretty tough for two if you spend any time in the room at all. Room 206 faces an interior courtyard and there’s no natural light. The room is quiet and away from stairs/elevator. There’s no dresser, but there’s a small closet. No in-room coffee or room service. You can get free coffee, juice and water in the lobby. There’s a small market and diner across the street. Easy walk to Harvard Square. Super helpful front desk staff. Good bed, bedding and sleep quality. Work station had no chair, just an ottoman.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, good location, teeny-tiny room

reviews.text: Staff is wonderful
reviews.title: Beautiful bijou boutique hotel in Cambridge
Harvard-Smart Hotel
reviews.text: Good bedding
Easy walk to Harvard Square & public transport
reviews.title: Very quaint hotel w/a great staff

reviews.text: Hotel Veritas is so perfect. My only complaint is that I only stayed one night. I arrived at the hotel well before check-in time and groggy from a red-eye flight. The front desk attendant was so wonderful and welcoming and worked a little magic to find a room for me several hours early. The staff was consistently outstanding. My room was small, but very well designed and everything was super comfortable. Great bathroom. Great bed. The free internet is fast and reliable. They also offer free passes to the gym across the street, so after my long flight, it was great to go work-out for a bit. I just love this place...and hope to return again soon.
reviews.title: Truly wonderful hotel
WOW!!!
reviews.text: What a wonderful place. I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to the Boston area. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left our stay was simply incredible. The customer service that not only we received, but that we witnessed others receiving as well was simply amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and superb customer service was delivered in the most delightfully natural way by every single employee we encountered. Do yourself a favor and check in as soon as possible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful 2 night stay at Hotel Veritas before we headed to Europe for our anniversary. The location is perfect, right in the heart of Cambridge and walking distance to Harvard and MIT (although Harvard is much closer). The subway station is a short walk so it is easy to get anywhere in the city from the hotel.
reviews.title: Truly 5 stars
Elegant and Great Location
reviews.text: The hotel itself is elegant. Everything from the small but welcoming lobby area, to the rooms is very high quality. The rooms are slightly on the small side, but they go to great lengths on their website to describe exactly what you are getting. My husband and I had two large bags as well as two carry-ons because we were heading to Europe for 2 weeks and we did not have any trouble fitting everything in our room. If you are worried about space just call the hotel and they will walk you through all the different types of rooms and help you decide what is best.

The concierges are so friendly and helpful. They helped to find wonderful nearby restaurants, told us about local shopping areas, and arranged transportation back to the airport. The service is exceptional. They really know how to take care of their guests.
reviews.title: Lovely

description: Hotel Veritas is a 31-room independent upscale hotel located in Harvard Square offering intimate service in a hip Cantabrigian setting. The entire look and feel of the hotel is elegant and current, but with a respectful nod towards our traditional and historic neighborhood. The guest rooms are designed with the fine detailing of an old New England residence and furnishings that are interesting contemporary pieces with rich fabrics and textures.
